REVIEW_TEXT: We recently spent 5 nights here and really enjoyed everything. The hotel is in a wonderful location - it's within walking distance of the Louvre, the shopping district, many restaurants, and even the Musee d'Orsay and the Eiffel Tower are within a bit longer walking distance. It's also located close to 2 metro stops. The staff is friendly and helpful, the rooms are comfortable and clean, and the breakfast is exceptional. There is also a small buffet available all day with non-alcoholic drinks. The mini bar is also restocked daily - no alcohol but water and juices. I would definitely stay here again.

The reception was friendly and professional and speedy. The room was ready and perfect. The bed was very comfortable and the air conditioning was silent and potent.  The free afternoon tea was amazing and open until 2 am.  The breakfast was one of the very best you could find in Paris.

We loved this hotel! My daughter has Celiac and they had gluten free options for her at breakfast. The room cozy and everyone on staff was incredibly helpful. It was a short walk to The Louvre and a quick Uber ride to other spots in the city. I would definitely stay at this hotel the next time I visit Paris.

The hotel is superbly located, a sort distance from both the Louvre and the Marais. The staff was very nice and provided helpful tips. The breakfast was excellent, and it was particularly useful that the hotel opened a free buffet with small things to eat and drink every afternoon. Really charming place, we would love to come back

While planning a trip to France, I found so many amazing reviews for this hotel and booked this one for a week in Paris.   Location: Great location in Paris. Easy to get around and close to the Metro and really in a great spot to walk everywhere.   Hotel: We had the privilege room with 3 people. It is of course small but perfectly laid out and honestly, we didn’t feel squished at all. Room is lovely. No complaints at all. Minibar in the room is a great touch and helps to just grab a drink after a long tourist day. The hotel breakfast was great - nice selection and constantly refilled. It was perfect. The people are all lovely and super helpful.   I can see why this hotel has so many amazing reviews and I’m happy that we booked here. Don’t hesitate to book this one for your trip to Paris. There are probably hundreds of hotels in Paris but there’s a reason this one is so highly rated.…

This hotel hits all the marks, and I agree with the reviews.  It is clean, uniquely quiet,  has the amenities one expects in this category without missing a step, and they are priced in the right category.  But the service is super exceptional, and sets the hotel apart.  I do not remember being welcomed so warmly and being treated with such care.  And having snacks and drinks in the lobby made us feel comfortable and at home.  They just make the stay easy for you.  A special thank you to Mr. Hazam who saved our flight.  Were it not for your advice to leave earlier, we would have missed our plane.  CDG processing was approximately 2.5 hours, with priority access.  Your recommended leave time was absolutely perfect.  Thank you so very much for your intervention!  And thank you for the snacks :)  We had left just before breakfast and Mr. Hazam packed us some snacks and had it ready for us when we came down.  That was above and beyond going above and beyond.  Big thank you!    Overall this hotel executes very well.  It's rare to stay somewhere without some annoyance, because you are away from home, but these folks have quietly eliminated common annoyances for you, so that you do feel more at home.  And then on top of that, the desk staff truly cares about your experience, such that whatever your preference or situation, they will make things easy and comfortable.  Thank you!…

Well located in Paris, the Hotel Malte has really nice and homely decor with the best customer service in the whole of Paris.  They have the best customer service I have experienced in the whole of Paris.  Staff were extremely friendly and helpful.  The also offered us free snacks and drinks in the lobby.  You can walk to some major tourist attractions easily from the hotel.  Definitely highly recommended.

Choosing a hotel in Paris is always a difficult task. Everything looks good online, but is it? Our stay at Hotel Malte was PERFECT! The room was lovely, the mattress was extremely comfortable, and all the special goodies they offer for free are wonderful. All of the staff are absolutely first rate!! They cater to their guests and work hard to make sure you are enjoying your stay. Seyil, Irene, Stephanie, Hakan and Sinian and all of the rest of the staff are the best. The hotel is in the 2nd arrondissement and is close to everything including the very cool Asian food district. It is a wonderful place to land in Paris.

Wonderful room and location, as well as kind, friendly staff.  The hotel also offers free snacks and drinks in the lobby, which was such an unexpected treat.  Amazing location for food and coffee shops!

We spent one night here on our way south. The hotel is in a brilliant location, friendly staff, super comfortable room and plentiful tasty breakfast. We will certainly be back the next time we’re in Paris.

Walking into hotel for first time we were impressed with the ambience, decor, cleanliness and spaciousness of lobby area.  Checking in was a seamless experience and all reception staff so friendly, professional, knowledgeable and helpful at checking and throughout our stay.   I saw from his badge Jorge was in training and he was fantastic.    Our room was clean, quiet and comfortable and breakfast was fresh and plentiful.  Can highly recommend which is in no small part due to the manners and helpfulness of the cleaning, reception and kitchen staff.   Very well done.

My husband and I stayed in five cities -- and six hotels -- across Europe for our honeymoon, and this was by far our favorite hotel. The location was wonderful -- convenient for walking and Metro, with restaurants and other activities nearby. The service from the staff was unparalleled; everyone was so friendly and patient with my poor French (and they spoke English!) And the breakfast, wow! Delicious! We will definitely stay here again if we are lucky enough to return to Paris.

The hotel is very neat and clean. Location is just perfect 300 m  from Louvre. It delivers everything it tells, but it is a 4star hotel so it has additional service. Breakfast ist very good quality but also self-service coffe from the coffee maschine self made.  Upon our arrival we wanted to have a little coctail in the hotel lobby but there was no one to serve us and they also told us they only serve tea an coffee. Room mini bar is included but also no wine or spirits are provided.  Overal very good experience clean an friendly staff but no aditional service. If you are looking for more luxurious experience I recommend a 5 star hotel.

We really appreciate the help we received from Seyil and Princess. They helped us get settled in and recommended great restaurants and trips to Louvre and Eiffel Tower. We hope they are recognized by their managers.

This place: the hotel, the rooms, the staff, the location, the prices....all top notch. I've already thought, if/when I get back to Paris, I'll likely stay here....  Paris is very expensive. This hotel does not skimp on quality, but the price was definitely one of the lowest I saw, short of a hostel or other undesired accommodation.  I started a review that I apparently lost. The staff are very friendly and helpful. There is a safe parking garage about 3-4 blocks away at The Bourse. It would be wise to book in advance for discounts. You can download a parking app to do it all electronically. I wish I knew that in advance.  There are a lot of useful establishments nearby (a carrefour (grocery store), a laundromat, a pharmacy as well as restaurants and a quick walk to the Palais…

Centrally located, wonderful staff, and they even gave us treats every day. The staff was wonderful, they gave us so many good tips to explore the city, and I highly recommend this hotel as it was definitely affordable. Felt very comfortable and at ease in the location.

The hotel is very well situated within walking distance to many of the popular tourist sites. The rooms were very clean and quiet, food was great and the service was exceptional particularly Irene. Would definitely stay here again and highly recommend!

Hotel Malte  - Astotel was great to stay at.  The staff are very attentive to your needs, and requests.  Very helpful if you need help in reserving restaurants or local attractions. They have many other hotels around the area where you can go to at anytime and use their facilities and have food/drinks etc... whenever you want.

The staff was extremely helpful, the rooms were perfect. Clean, comfortable and quiet. The breakfast buffet was extensive, and the complimentary afternoon break included soft drinks, pastries cookies and snacks of all variety. Easy walking distance to the Louvre, Sene and Notre Dame.

Very nice staff, amazing breakfast and beautiful rooms! Keep doing what your are doing!  The rooms were always cleaned and taken care of, everyday the staff made sure we were comfortable and happy. The breakfast room is always very clean and organized and the variety is nice too

HOTEL_NAME: Atrium Palace Thalasso Spa Resort & Villas
REVIEW_TEXT: A warm welcome from the start.  Clean rooms and balcony view over one of the pools - extending to the sea beyond.  You can catch a sunrise from the beach - because it's on the west coast.  The west coast is also far less windy - allowing for some wonderful boat trips.  The sea is warm and welcoming - though the beaches are shingle/stone- so some water shoes recommended.  Poolside service via an app - or the swim up bar is excellent - along with any food you may want. Both served quickly and of excellent quality.  The bar staff... Stratos, Stephanos and Liiliana are so lovely. Young, fun and cheery.   At the restaurant we were greeted daily by the lovely Pari who was delightful, friendly and always helpful.  She always had a smile and a welcome to make us feel like old friends.    The room itself was clean with fresh linen & towels whenever you needed.  The mini-bar stocked up daily (and all part of the all inclusive package).       If you take the Tui trip to Simi - it is a 10 hour long day.   (not 8 as advertised).   Swimming gear is not required (as suggested).  and the day is hot and long and tough - but Simi is stunning.    Lindos by local bus €1.80 each - each way was simple (from bus stop 40) although it is sweaty too!   NB there is a shuttle bus from the bus terminus in Lindos (if you want to avoid the steep climb back) for just €0.50!!!…

HOTEL_NAME: Atrium Palace Thalasso Spa Resort & Villas
REVIEW_TEXT: We stayed at the beautiful hotel for a week in May on a B&B basis and then for two weeks in July (12th -20th) on the Premium All Inclusive basis.  For our stay in May we booked a Junior Suite (1st Floor) and in July a Standard Side Sea room (3rd Floor) both in the main hotel.  My husband and I have stayed in many hotels on differing Greek islands and this little piece of heaven knocks spots off the rest.  I could ramble on about the cleanliness of the rooms, the gardens, the pool and the beach along with the high quality food on offer every day and the international branded alcohol and local wine which we both founds superb (the dry Rose is excellent) but you will read all about these wonder factors on everybody else's reviews - I guarantee it because it is true, regardless of how full the hotel was (bearing in mind we have seem both early and mid season capacity).  As impressed as I was/am about how the hotel looked, I was more impressed with how the staff were as I consider it a real reflection on the Management of a hotel.  interesting fact coming up;  Staff do not leave the Atrium Palace very often (that tells you one thing for a start) and it is not easy to get a position there - regardless of what that position is.  Staff want to be there and that is clearly evident on how they work. Whether you are bumping into a member of the Housekeeping Team first thing in the morning, or passing a Bell Boy last thing at night, you will always be cordially greeted, and they recruit locally to the Hotel whenever possible. They feel appreciated by their Management and this had a direct reflection on how they treat their guests.   We had a delay in our flight home (well actually many but that's another story) but without fuss or ado, the staff continued to treat us a guests for the following 18 hours and went over and above to try to alleviate some of stress we were experiencing.   I asked to see the Manager, Apostolos to express our appreciation of their kindness and was told he would be over to see us in 5 minutes - which we was. No hiding behind office doors at this hotel!  Time for some mentions, which if you are going to book this hotel, I would make note of because they are such good ambassadors of the hotel group.  Savvas, Sortiris and the wonderful Nathalia in the restaurant will guide you to your table in the Dining Hall.  Rena will serve you excellent coffee with a smile throughout the day at the main bar.  Stratos, Stefano, Beatrice and Francesca will keep you topped up with drinks and snacked as the pool bar. (Beatrice and Francesca will also be in the main bar in the evenings and once they've served you, they remember not only your order but your room numbers also!)  Irini and Ioannis will keep your coffee and fresh orange juice topped up at breakfast and advise of the al la carte meals in the evening.  And Lucas at the beach will supply you fresh towels and greet you with a friendly fist pump.  We salute you all for your constant hard work in making sure everybody's holiday is as relaxing as it is memorable.  Obviously i'm a fan and have already booked for 2 weeks in July 2023 (taking my sister and brother in law) and a week in September for just the two of us.  and in the words said to us by Apostolos upon our departure, our guest are like family so we do not say 'goodbye', we say 'see you later' - and they will.…

HOTEL_NAME: Atrium Palace Thalasso Spa Resort & Villas
REVIEW_TEXT: Stayed here a week a go. Lovely clean resort. Everywhere immaculate. Food excellent & a good variety of restaurants serving beautiful dishes. Staff excellent. Nothing to much trouble. A special thanks to Rena in the main bar, who always had our cappuccinos ready. Pari in the restaurant, always had time for everyone. Francesca, bringing us our drinks to our sun beds ( sorry about the steps! 😎)  The only thing that lets the hotel down. Is the decor in the rooms. It is a little dated, with the dark furniture.  But the rooms have plenty of storage & the cleanest room I have ever stayed in. The cleaners do an amazing job.

HOTEL_NAME: Atrium Palace Thalasso Spa Resort & Villas
REVIEW_TEXT: Fantastic hotel, very clean, smart and we'll laid out. Very friendly staff and great food in the restaurants. A huge thank you to Apostolos and Savvas for taking great care of us and Soteris and Mika for looking after us in the restaurants and Rena in the bar! Highly recommend visiting and we look forward to going back again as soon as we can.

HOTEL_NAME: Atrium Palace Thalasso Spa Resort & Villas
REVIEW_TEXT: Can't fault this hotel at all. Everything about it was amazing, from the rooms, restaurants, pools and garden areas. The staff are fantastic, friendly and courteous and will do all that they can to assist you. Food is top quality and plentiful with a good variety. 10/10 highly recommend.

HOTEL_NAME: Atrium Palace Thalasso Spa Resort & Villas
REVIEW_TEXT: We are currently on our 3rd day of 6 here. Love it already!  The staff are so friendly and helpful - can't remember all their names, but a few examples are Alexis, Marilena, Sotiris!  We had a lovely dinner last night in the Vista Mare restaurant (1 of the 4 restaurants here). The food is excellent - plentiful and big selection, and the facilities - rooms, gym, spa, pools etc. all great. Can't recommend the Atrium Palace enough!

HOTEL_NAME: Atrium Palace Thalasso Spa Resort & Villas
REVIEW_TEXT: This is the first time I express my opinion about a hotel and it was so necessary: ​​it is one of the best hotels I've been to in Greece.  If not the best of them especially I would like to mention the  dear manager Savvas so kind and helpful.  In general, I have not encountered such a high level of service in a long time in hotels.  Definitely the hotel to return to next time in Rhodes❤️

HOTEL_NAME: Atrium Palace Thalasso Spa Resort & Villas
REVIEW_TEXT: Me and my girlfriend  travelled here in September for a get away. We were extrememly impressed with the hotel. Firstly, the rooms; super clean loads of spaces and what was impressive that the room service cleaned twice a day. The hotel also has an app which is amazing you can order food drinks and snacks to anywhere in the hotel. The food was also great I wold recommend lobster night to anyone on Wednesday but the buffet had some great options with good rotation. You can also hire a private boat from the hotel, which is an amazing day. The water is crystal clear and the beaches you can access are beautiful. To add to all of this the hotel is very peaceful and the staff are super helpful - we had a situation where out mac charger broke and one of the staff members purchased a charger for us in Rhodes town which is 45 min away. The hotel also has a fantastic beach which is great for sunrises at this time of year at 6;50 in the morning and you are only 10 min away from a great little town called Lindos you will find everything there from restaurants, bars, clubs, and places to take photo.  I highly recommend this hotel :)…

HOTEL_NAME: Atrium Palace Thalasso Spa Resort & Villas
REVIEW_TEXT: Stayed for 9 nights in late August 2022.  The beach is a couple of hundred yards from the bottom of the hotel grounds.  The hotel's beach is exclusively used by guests - there's a virtually unused public beach on either side. The hotel has loads of sunbeds at the beach and the pools, set up in pairs under parasols which are numbered as part of the app ordering system.  We never once struggled to find group of 6 beds for our party . The food was pretty good - standard buffet with daily variations for the theme which are cooked to order. The only complaint in our party was the omelettes - not very well cooked and very little range/variety in the fillings. The service was superb - especially the golf cart to transport us from reception to our rooms on checkin! Other than the 1 barman the staff were brilliant. There are 2 shower rooms to use on checkout day which can be booked for free for half hour slots so you can wash before leaving. The only niggle was that the decor, furnishings etc, whilst being perfectly fit-for purpose, in good nick and very well cleaned/maintained, they were poor in their design and cohesion - they completely failed to create a feel-good feeling. Basically they should have used a much better interior designer and spent a little bit more.  Despite this hotel being more expensive, and having better service, it just doesn't compare to something like the Baobab on Gran Canaria in terms of design, furnishings and making you feel like you're in another world. …

HOTEL_NAME: Atrium Palace Thalasso Spa Resort & Villas
REVIEW_TEXT: I have just read a review saying that the hotel did not come to expectations. Sometimes I cannot believe they have stayed at the same hotel. My Wife Anne and I have travelled to most places in the world and this hotel is probably the best by a considerable distance. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, we felt extremely welcome; there was nothing that was too much bother for any of the staff. Apostolos  the Manager is a hands on manager who is always available in all parts of the hotel. He should be incredibly proud of his staff. I have never met such attentive people. They all made our stay of 10 days very special. We felt, as I guess most other people that we were very important to them all and nothing was too much bother. Special mention to our lovely restaurant staff, Valentina ( we love you); Mariella, Alex is and Natalie and Peri.  All of them made our stay so wonderful. At night, in the cocktail bar, special mention to lovely Ladina: the sweetest girl, good luck with your studies and the lovely Beatrice. Thank you both. You were exceptional. The hotel has it right. The food was superb at all meals, offering themed evenings nearly every day. The entertainment was great. The service at our pool for drinks and food was brilliant. We'll done for the app which allows you to order food and drinks. Yet another plus. The pool and grounds were beautiful.  All in all, if we go back to Rhodes, we wouldn't stay anywhere else. Thank you Atrium Palace. Thank you Apostolos and all of your wonderful staff. We would recommend you every time.…

HOTEL_NAME: Atrium Palace Thalasso Spa Resort & Villas
REVIEW_TEXT: The location of the hotel is amazing on a fabulous peaceful beach in a small village close to Lindos and a one hour bus journey from Rhodes Town. We recently spent a week in a Villa with a private pool. This was our 3rd visit to this beautiful well run hotel and it was our best yet-we love it! The warmth of the welcome from Apostolos the manager and every member of staff is wonderful (in fact this applies to all three Atrium hotels) and the facilities just seem to get better each visit. The addition of a cantina on the beach is most welcome. We enjoyed coffee with a view there most mornings and loved chatting to Stergos and the rest of the team. We stayed on a bed and breakfast basis so we could eat out at night in local restaurants. The breakfasts were amazing as was the…

HOTEL_NAME: Atrium Palace Thalasso Spa Resort & Villas
REVIEW_TEXT: This was billed as a luxury 5 star resort hotel which is most definitely isn't, I would say it's a pleasant enough 4 star. The food at the a la carte restaurants was excellent however the main buffet restaurant was poor - limited fresh choices and everything was always cold or at best luke warm. We paid a huge amount extra for a swim up pool - DO NOT BOTHER! This was freezing cold as they never get the sun and was not fit for purpose - we couldn't go in it at all. The main pools were also cold (not quite as cold though) - the one pool that was a lovely temperature at the top of the resort was also not fit for purpose however as the steps leading in to the pool had broken and were coming away from the walls and floor. So basically couldn't go swimming in any of the outdoor pools…

HOTEL_NAME: Atrium Palace Thalasso Spa Resort & Villas
REVIEW_TEXT: Back on Tuesday from a week at this lovely hotel.  Reception Polite and professional, welcome drink, buggy to room, very spectacular reception area, very clean Maps available, staff helpful  Room Very clean, shampoo and body lotion with sewing kit etc Room number 433 Patio door leading to sea view limited and three swimming pools with garden Two sun loungers, two chairs with table Very quiet and peaceful Big and comfy bed, TV and chargeable mini bar, safe which was free to use, slippers and dressing gown Sofa bed Very clean, maids came daily, very good clean each day Nepresso Maxine with four given per day, can buy in supermarket in hotel one euro each capsule Fruit and wine  Restaurant Natalia is amazing and such an asset, such big smile and helpful. Well done,Natalia. Young…

HOTEL_NAME: Atrium Palace Thalasso Spa Resort & Villas
REVIEW_TEXT: Very nice stay. Very clean and friendly employees.  Thank you very much to Savas for his help and warm welcome. Tanks to Ioannis and Rena!  We stayed the 4th time now and we always enjoy our stay. We will come again.

HOTEL_NAME: Atrium Palace Thalasso Spa Resort & Villas
REVIEW_TEXT: We cannot rate this hotel highly enough. This is our second holiday at the Palace, and we have had a awesome time,  just like the first time we were there. The staff are absolutely superb, very friendly and courteous. A special thanks has to go to the Pool Bar team. Thanks Guys for the fun and laughter. The food is excellent and the location superb. We will definitely be returning to our little bit of paradise. ❤️

HOTEL_NAME: Atrium Palace Thalasso Spa Resort & Villas
REVIEW_TEXT: Me and my wife just came back on 20/10/22 and what can I say?? We had the most perfect holiday , Atrium Palace Thalasso Spa Resort & Villas resort is brilliant and we would recommend to anyone , we came as a couple and we all had a fantastic time , we were sad to be going home. The staff here go above and beyond , each and every single one of them from the bell boy, receptionist, waiters/waitresses and also the the management.  Food - Perfect. My wife had been given plenty of Dairy free  and Gluten free options. Facilities - Brilliant Beach -  Clear waters and was only around 3-5 minute walk from the hotel with free towels and sun loungers Room - Coffee machine, fruit , bottle of wine and a minibar. Towels changed everyday day  Overall shad such an amazing stay. Will definetley…

HOTEL_NAME: Atrium Palace Thalasso Spa Resort & Villas
REVIEW_TEXT: We had previously stayed at the Atrium Platinum outside Rhodes and I started off comparing the two hotels.  However, I soon stopped as they have different things to offer.  What is common in both hotels is the excellent, friendly service from the staff and when you have that, it starts to makes any stay enjoyable.   We stayed in a standard room with limited sea view and it was spacious with a very large balcony to sit out on.  The room was cleaned efficiently and well.  Towels were changed at least once a day and a small bottle of water was left every morning.  The wine and fruit on the first day is a lovely touch.  My only criticism (and it's to do with age!) is having to climb over a bath to use the shower - it's hard when you have a bad back.   Breakfast has super choices and…

HOTEL_NAME: Atrium Palace Thalasso Spa Resort & Villas
REVIEW_TEXT: The hotel is really perfect. On arrival, you are greeted with a welcome drink (sparkling wine or orange juice) and after a short break, you are taken to your room by cart. In the room there is a fruit basket and a bottle of wine to welcome you. There is also a Nespresso machine and a kettle and tea. In the bathroom there is a hairdryer, towels and the most important hygiene products. Valuables can be locked in the safe. The rooms and the entire complex were very clean and well maintained. There are free-roaming, but not intrusive, cats throughout the complex that are happy to be petted. The hotel's own beach is only a few minutes away and is, like the complex, very clean. There were always enough sunbeds on the beach. As it is a pebble beach, you should definitely take extra…

HOTEL_NAME: Atrium Palace Thalasso Spa Resort & Villas
REVIEW_TEXT: It was an amazing experience from the minute we stepped in the palace, and up until we left!! We were celebrating our 28th civil wedding anniversary and  certainly chose the right place to make some great memories. They catered for my dietary needs (gluten free and dairy free) a lot of options, which is not usually the case for me. Service amazing, very friendly staff  - special thanks to  Klaidi and Sotris

HOTEL_NAME: Atrium Palace Thalasso Spa Resort & Villas
REVIEW_TEXT: We have stayed at the Atrium Palace 6 times now, inc twice this year. We have no desire to go anywhere else now as this is our home from home and is very well maintained and spotlessly clean. The staff always remember you every year (including what you drink) and make you feel so welcome. The food is excellent in whichever restaurant you choose to be it the main restaurant, the A la carte and the Italian restaurants, the pool restaurant or at the pool bar with Sratos and his teamThe main restaurant buffet has a different theme night so it’s never the same, and you can order also order from a menu if you choose to. Pari &Natali and all the others will take care of your every need in this one. A different act every night outside the main bar run by the excellent cocktail maker…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Aydinli Mah. Gorceli Sok. No:5, Goreme 50180 Turkey
REVIEW_TEXT: We really appreciated our stay at Divan Cave in beautiful Goreme. We wish we could have stayed longer. The rooms are very charming, clean and comfortable. The breakfast was very good. Staff was always very attentive, helpful and friendly. Special thanks to Eliz and Kenan, who made our stay even more enjoyable. Also, location is perfect to walk throughout the town and have stunning views from the roof top deck.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Aydinli Mah. Gorceli Sok. No:5, Goreme 50180 Turkey
REVIEW_TEXT: This place was located in an amazing area. The views from the terrace were exceptional and through out the property there were areas to chill. The rooms were really nice and the experience staying there was awesome!!! The staff were really good but Eliz was AMAZING!!! Everything she did turned out perfect amd all her recommendations were spot on like the restaurants she recommended. She was the one I communicated with through booking and I was so impressed when I met her in person.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Aydinli Mah. Gorceli Sok. No:5, Goreme 50180 Turkey
REVIEW_TEXT: This hotel is special in several ways. It is located at the highest point in Gorëme, and if you go to the huge terrace bar above, you will not regret. On top of the terrace bar, there is a second, smaller terrace, and there, you are at the top of Gorëme, with a magnificent 360 degrees view, where I made a very nice video. If you drive to the hotel by car, be patient on the winding streets up, since the tourist vans will annoy you and block the streets quite often. Note: this hotel is not "downtown", is at the top of the Goreme hill, with the best views. You have to decide if you prefer the unforgettable view, or the busy area. The staff is really friendly. They have their own local travel arrangements, and we could book a balloon flight and a Dervish ceremony. Eliz or Kenan are helpful to inform you about the details and arrangements. They will ask you to pay the trips in cash, to avoid credit card commissions to you (you can, of course, pay with card). Therefore, consider bringing cash if you book trips with them. Surely you can withdraw locally, but all ATMs in Turkey charge you high commissions. At the first sight, the breakfast looked a bit “lean” to me (e.g.: no scrambled eggs), but they take your orders for that, or omelettes. The breakfast room also has a sunny terrace with nice views. Surely the variety may improve a bit. The place is very cosy, and the access to some rooms may be funny, via outside stairs. If you bring heavy luggage, ask for help. No elevator available... The room was spacious and the decoration was vintage. The room windows don’t have noise abatement, therefore it is recommended to bring earplugs. My room was facing the street where the vans pick-up the tourists for the balloon trip in the middle of the night, and it was noisy. Be aware of that. Or ask for a room away from the street.…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Aydinli Mah. Gorceli Sok. No:5, Goreme 50180 Turkey
REVIEW_TEXT: The hotel staff was nice! Rose, Solange and Kennan were all so hospitable and welcoming! The terrace has a nice bar for hanging out at night or viewing the balloons in the morning! Def recommend. Shower is also really nice!!

HOTEL_LOCATION: Aydinli Mah. Gorceli Sok. No:5, Goreme 50180 Turkey
REVIEW_TEXT: We had a warm and nice welcome and felt comfortable and at ease.   We stayed in the honeymoon suit with private jacuzzi and balcony.  The room is spacious and clean. However, we were a bit disappointed because nothing special was prepared in the room (welcome card,flowers,chocolate,…). We would have appreciated a special attention for the honeymoon stay.  Unfortunately we experienced a bad experience with the bathroom door that wasn’t well fixed, and fell on my arm and head, injuring me. There was also a problem with the hot water of the shower, either the water was coming very hot or very cold. Making it difficult to have an average temperature.  We talked about it at the reception but we didn’t feel like they were really concerned about it. However they send somebody to fix the door but no one to fix the shower.   - Location : 9/10. Amazing view, calm, close to centre and restaurants.  - Staff : 8/10 warm and welcoming. Especially the staff at breakfast was very attentive. We just missed that extra customer service with regards to our honeymoon suite.  - Room : 8/10. Clean, away from other rooms, nice balcony and private jacuzzi. However the door wasn’t fixed, towel holder not fixed, problem with hot water.  - Breakfast : 7/10 We loved the eggs but missed variety and fresh juices  - Rooftop 9/10: amazing view, well decorated.…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Aydinli Mah. Gorceli Sok. No:5, Goreme 50180 Turkey
REVIEW_TEXT: We had a lovely few days staying at the Divan caves. The staff were amazing; so kind and helpful with organising our airport transfers from Kayseri and booking us onto the excursions we chose to do (horse riding and ATV tour).  The breakfast was so good and offered a lot of choice. Again, the staff at the hotel were so welcoming and even offered to sort us some food the morning of our departure. We were lucky to see the balloons 2/3 of the mornings we stayed. I would highly recommend this hotel! 10/10

HOTEL_LOCATION: Aydinli Mah. Gorceli Sok. No:5, Goreme 50180 Turkey
REVIEW_TEXT: We had the best experience at this gorgeous hotel. WE had the honeymoon suite that had a private jacuzzi overlooking a private balcony which we loved so much, we chose it because it had the best cave rooms, best reviews, and the best rooftop view in Goreme. We are so happy we stayed here, Divan Cave Hotel went above and beyond to make sure we had the best honeymoon. They booked all our airport transfers, our tours, hot air ballon, photoshoot with the flying dress experience, and even helped us cancel a tour easily when we could no longer go. Traveling so far from the U.S. was easier because of their help. And their hospitality was incredible they provided help with anything we needed. And the views were the best here for the hot air balloons. We had the best time here thanks to this incredible staff KENAN, ELIZ, SOLA, and SINAN who helped make this the best trip we appreciate the 4 of you helping us so much. BEST HOTEL, BEST VIEWS, BEST STAFF, BEST CAPPADOCIA EXPERIENCE OF OUR LIVES!!!…

HOTEL_LOCATION: Aydinli Mah. Gorceli Sok. No:5, Goreme 50180 Turkey
REVIEW_TEXT: It was a great staying at this hotel. The room is very comfy, cool bath tube. The hotel is on the hill side where can see the night view of the valley. Staff Kenan and Sola were very helpful in our journey. They always serve us with tea and nice coffee. They taught us a lot about the Turkish culture and things to see in here. Very excellent staff.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Aydinli Mah. Gorceli Sok. No:5, Goreme 50180 Turkey
REVIEW_TEXT: We stayed at Divan for two nights and had loved our stay. The views and breakfast were amazing and the staff were incredibly kind and helpful (Kenan and Eran). The hotel also arranged for a sightseeing tour for us which was so informative and convenient

HOTEL_LOCATION: Aydinli Mah. Gorceli Sok. No:5, Goreme 50180 Turkey
REVIEW_TEXT: Divan is an amazing hotel with the perfect view of the balloons in the valley. Their rooms are very comfortable, the service is exceptional and the breakfast was the best I have ever had at a hotel. This was one of the most unique experiences I've ever had. Kenan and Eren were very helpful throughout our stay and made it absolutely perfect

HOTEL_LOCATION: Aydinli Mah. Gorceli Sok. No:5, Goreme 50180 Turkey
REVIEW_TEXT: First timers here in Cappadocia and just based on online reviews, decided to book our accommodation with Divan Cave Hotel - best decision ever for our side trip!  We stayed  for 4d3n and  everything was just perfect.  From the cozy cave rooms with the best view of the surrounding caves and valleys, the sumptuous daily breakfast spread, and most importantly, the warmth of everyone whom we had a chance to interact with.   To name a few - Sinan and Solange.  Everyone were so accommodating and you will genuinely feel that they want you to have the best experience while in Cappadocia.  This place is already magical as it is but even made better with the people from Divan Cave Hotel.  Teşekkürler!

HOTEL_LOCATION: Aydinli Mah. Gorceli Sok. No:5, Goreme 50180 Turkey
REVIEW_TEXT: Eliz helped me with arranging all my activities with no fuss, Solanch treated us like a family whilst Sinan made us feel at home! Our room had the best view yet reasonably priced. And oh don't even think of skipping bfast, they have a wide variety of delish food... i hope when i return, they will have an inhouse restaurant!  You made our Cappadocia trip Awesome and Memorable!

HOTEL_LOCATION: Aydinli Mah. Gorceli Sok. No:5, Goreme 50180 Turkey
REVIEW_TEXT: A special stay in goreme at the most beautiful hotel. Couldn’t have picked a better place. The staff were so attentive and helpful. We had all our excursions and transfers booked by them and no request was impossible. The views are incredible from the hotel with a beautiful terrace where you can see all the hot air balloons and also relax on in the evenings. the room was clean spacious and comfortable. Location wise it was close to all the shops and restaurants. All tours could easily be arranged with pick up from the hotel. Breakfast was tasty with lots of variety. A special thanks to sinnan, solange, gud, enteres and kenin and everyone else at the hotel for making our stay unforgettable.   Divya and Nik

HOTEL_LOCATION: Aydinli Mah. Gorceli Sok. No:5, Goreme 50180 Turkey
REVIEW_TEXT: We were stay in Divan Cave Hotel for 4 days. And experience was absolutely amazing! Hotel the best! Rooftop, service, rooms, location and stuff. Everything was excellent! Especially service from lady of reception Solange. She helped me a lot. She was super nice. And Kenan too. Umit guy also helped us with our stuff. Thank you Divan! We will come back very soon!

HOTEL_LOCATION: Aydinli Mah. Gorceli Sok. No:5, Goreme 50180 Turkey
REVIEW_TEXT: Keenan, Sola, Rose were amazing host/hostess! They were accommodating and friendly.  We enjoyed our stay at the resort with the wonderful service and beautifully 360 view of the city. Highly recommend! 👍

HOTEL_LOCATION: Aydinli Mah. Gorceli Sok. No:5, Goreme 50180 Turkey
REVIEW_TEXT: Stayed at Divan for 3 nights. It’s at one of highest points in Goreme, so views are fantastic. The terrace is large and “instagram” worthy if that’s something you’re interested in. The room we had was quite spacious including the bathroom. Shower and hot water was fantastic and AC was strong. They had an excellent breakfast buffet spread, and can make omelets or scrambled eggs to order. Staff was all very friendly.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Aydinli Mah. Gorceli Sok. No:5, Goreme 50180 Turkey
REVIEW_TEXT: Lovely location. This hotel has the best rooftop views.  Friendly and helpful customer service. Kenan was great at hospitality. Good breakfast selection. Would come back to this hotel. Well worth the visit.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Aydinli Mah. Gorceli Sok. No:5, Goreme 50180 Turkey
REVIEW_TEXT: Stayed here for a few nights with the family. The king room with the jacuzzi was fab, the views from the roof tops are something else! They possibly have the highest view point overlooking the town. Service from Kenan was on-point, friendly and really helpful. Definitely recommend this place if you’re looking for a luxury stay in cappadocia.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Aydinli Mah. Gorceli Sok. No:5, Goreme 50180 Turkey
REVIEW_TEXT: We opted to stay at Divan Cave House for two nights of our Cappadocia visit for the rooftop experience but it ended up being so much more!  We had booked a balloon flight externally from the hotel which was unfortunately cancelled the night before. Kenan was amazing in sourcing us another flight for the very next day (nearly impossible for this time of year). Kenan was so friendly and put us at ease when we were really stressed about potentially missing the activity. I would 100% recommend booking all your activities through the staff at Divan Cave House - they are so helpful, attentive and provide some great recommendations.   We stayed in an fairy chimney room - a very cool experience! Thank you to Kenan and Divan Cave House for a great time in Cappadocia.

HOTEL_LOCATION: Aydinli Mah. Gorceli Sok. No:5, Goreme 50180 Turkey
REVIEW_TEXT: The views here are amazing with extremely great service! Kenan was great at making sure we had a great experience here, when we came early to the check in the room wasn’t ready because we cane too early but they provided great hospitality by providing us drinks and cookies for waiting. When we wanted a tour of the city he was able to get us a tour bus to pick us up from the hotel and drop us back off. They make it easy to check out too, When we couldn’t attend breakfast because of our flight being early, they made us breakfast boxes for us to eat on the way to the airport.

My family loved this hotel. Its centrally located and close to so many tourist attractions and shows. The room was very clean and comfortable. The staff were so friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay again!

This was our first trip to London, so we wanted to pick a hotel that would be centrally-located so we didn't spend hours every day just commuting to our destinations. The location for The Resident Covent Garden turned out to be absolutely perfect! There are multiple tube stations within a short walk, hundreds of restaurants and shops, and  if you want to see a show it's right in the theatre district. In terms of food, I should add that you can choose anything from quick takeaway bites like kebabs, fast casual establishments, all the way up to Michelin-starred establishments. You could also choose from Italian, Greek, Asian, British, French, Jamaican, Turkish, and just about anything else you can think of. Should you happen to have forgotten anything essential at home, there are also multiple stores nearby (Boots, Tesco Express, Superdrug, Sainsbury Local), which was great since we had our 8-year old son with us.  As far as the hotel itself, we found our room very spacious (especially by European standards), and the built-in USB chargers were helpful (we brought enough adapters with us but some people may not). The Nespresso machine and mini-fridge was a lifesaver, as I really need my morning coffee with real milk to get going. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We were on the fifth floor and it was so quiet you would have never guessed that we were in such a busy area of central London.  There are only two minor nitpicks I can think of. The first is that the doors for the kitchenette didn't shut properly, so the light remained on (it turns off when the doors are closed). We engineered a DIY solution and in fairness we never mentioned it to the staff. The second thing was a few days while we were out, we indicated on our door that we were not in our room. Despite that our room was not serviced that day. For us it didn't matter because we simply reused our towels and any toiletries were supplied promptly upon asking. But some guests may have disliked being skipped for a housekeeping visit.   Overall we were extremely happy with this hotel. We were there for 10 days and after a long day visiting museums and seeing sights, it really felt like a nice, comfortable place to retire for the evening. When we return to London this place will be right at the top of our list!…

I loved this hotel. Staff was fantastic and very helpful. Made great recommendations for food and things to do. Room was modern and very clean. It had great amenities.  Will definitely be back. Thanks for all the help.

We made arrangements to stay at The Resident for two nights before our flight back to the States. From the first moment we wished we had stayed much longer. Our room was quiet, the bed was incredibly comfortable, and the staff was delightful. Best of all is the neighborhood, around the corner from Covent Garden Market and a short walk from the National Gallery, shops, restaurants, and other attractions. As an added bonus, our room had a spacious balcony with views of charming London roof tops and the Eye. I think we have found the perfect place to stay in London!

This was my second stay at this hotel.  I love staying there.  The location is great, the rooms are comfortable and well thought out.  The mini-kitchens are very nice to have.  Because of the mini-kitchen I only eat out one meal a day.  The housekeepers do a great job,  Really everyone that works there is pleasant and helpful.

The RESIDENT is a top notch place to stay in London’s Covent Garden.  The TItle of this review says it al.  Plus Gianna at the front desk is a dream with whom to work.  Would readily stay there again.  We’ll located for major tourist sites and West End theatres.

We really enjoyed the location of this hotel. The staff were all friendly and helpful. Our room had ample space for luggage and clothes. The mini bar area was perfect with small fridge, sink, filtered water, plates etc. We will come again when back in London.

The Resident is a great hotel in a great location, only a few minutes from Trafalgar Square, just off The Strand. It's within 10-20 minutes walking distance of so many central London locations: Covent Garden, St. Martin in the Fields, The National Gallery, The Mall, Buckingham Palace, Parliament, The Thames, Victoria Embankment, Piccadilly Circus, The British Museum, The Courtauld Gallery, plenty of theaters, and a ton of restaurants  and pubs. It is a beautifully kept hotel; housekeeping is excellent; and the front desk is staffed by exceptionally friendly, kind people who clearly made a point of making us feel welcome during our week-long stay.

I had a great stay in The Resident. This is my second time staying in this hotel. I will definitely stay here again!! Loved the room and the warm courteous staff. Also appreciated the welcome bottle of wine and congratulatory balloons in view of my daughter's commencement of her Masters programme in a London university.

We always stay at the Resident Hotel in Covent Garden, in the heart of Central London,  With delightful & helpful staff, immaculate & quiet rooms, serviced by a host of eateries and tourist  attractions on it’s doorstep, a stay is always a joy!

We loved everything about this hotel.  Staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were very nice,  clean and comfortable.  location is excellent with lots of good restaurants and cafes.  we'll definitely come back again.

The stay at the hotel was perfect for what I was after - two days of sightseeing and shopping. Location convenient, fantastic team and lovely rooms. The recommendations for dinner and morning coffee were also very good! I'll be back next time I'm in London.

This a centrally located in Covent Gardens. The room was clean and the staff generally helpful. There is no real lounge area and no breakfast. There is a minifridge in the room.  There is a small supermarket just down the block. The room was quiet in spite of being in a relatively noisy area and the beds comfortable. We had a standard room which was someone cramped.

I stayed at the Resident for a couple of nights while visiting London. This was the second time I chose it. The location couldn't be better. Great access to everything London. The room was excellent and the staff super helpful.

Wonderful stay! The hotel and our room were immaculate, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the double windows kept our room quiet even at the peak of Saturday nightlife. Having a microwave and fridge made it easy to eat the occasional meal in the room, but there are dozens of restaurants nearby at a number of price points.   The location was an outstanding base for exploring London--close to multiple Underground lines, tons of buses around the corner on the Strand, and walkable to lots of restaurants, shopping, and West End theaters.  My only quibble with the hotel--our bath/shower seemed to be on a raised base, so climbing in and out was a bit treacherous and slippery after a shower. If you have any sort of mobility issues, I would recommend confirming that the tub in your…

We were just in town for 2 nights.  We loved the ease of getting to this hotel from either the Leicester Square or Covent Garden tube stations.  Our room was contemporary, with lots of large windows looking out over the Strand.  But a very quiet room, nonetheless.  Bathroom was modern with a good shower.  Bed was very comfortable.  The front desk staff is excellent.  Always 2 people present to answer any questions.  Eva made great restaurant recommendations.  We never had to walk more than a block or two to find excellent meals!  We would definitely stay here again.

The Resident exceeded our expectations.  Excellent location, friendly and accommodating staff and a quiet sleep.  Rooms are clean and the mini kitchenette allowed us to eat breakfast in. Would definitely stay there again.

Wow oh wow! Beautiful is all I can say. My husband really hit the nail on the head with this one. My anniversary will always be remembered as I couldn’t find anything wrong with this hotel! I wish I could’ve stayed longer. Will be booking this for my son and soon to be daughter in law.

Visiting London with our 12 year old grandson, The Resident provided an excellent experience for the duration of our stay. The room was immaculately clean, had outstanding storage options, a handy and very useable mini kitchen, along with a great bathroom. Sheets and towels were of superior quality. The staff added a very comfortable roll away bed at the end of the room’s king bed, which cut down on floor space, but even with the added bed, we were able to maneuver comfortably when relaxing in the room. Just steps out The Resident’s door there are easy Tube connections, restaurants galore, and many options of convenience shops. The Resident’s location makes any activity and/or site accessible. Front desk staff was always welcoming, but upon check in, we were not informed of The…

Stayed here for 1 night recently, and my husband and I were very happy with it. Our favorite part about The Resident was how conveniently located it is, within walking distance of restaurants, cafes, West End shows, the London Underground stations, and sights for tourists. The staff were very friendly and accommodating, helping us store our luggage when we arrived before check-in time, and suggested we borrow hotel umbrellas due to unpredictable weather. The hotel has a complimentary wine-hour from 6-7 PM, which was a nice bonus! The room was very luxurious, the view in our room was great but insulated from traffic noise. The room was equipped with a fridge, a bar area with cups/utensils, and included a Brita filtration system attached to the bar sink, and complimentary…
